jmortgage.payment
Interface PmtCalculator

All Known Implementing Classes:
CanadianPmtCalculator, DefaultPmtCalculator
public interface PmtCalculator

A payment calculator for a fixed mortgage. An implementation of this interface calculates the interval payment of a fixed mortgage given the interest rate, loan amount, and length of mortgage term in years. The interval between each payment is defined by Interval.

Since:
1.0
Author:
David Armstrong

Method Detail

getLoanAmt

double getLoanAmt()
Gets the loan amount used to determine the payment.

Returns:
loan amount as double.

getInterestRate

double getInterestRate()
Gets the interest rate used to determine the payment.

Returns:
interest rate as double.

getIntervalInterestRate

double getIntervalInterestRate()
Gets the interval interest rate used to determine the payment. This value is used by implementations of DefaultFixedAmortizationBuilder when building an amortization table.

Returns:
interval interest rate as double.

getPmtCt

int getPmtCt()
Gets the payment count used to determine the payment. For a 30 year loan with a monthly payment interval, this value would be 360.

Returns:
payment count as int.

getYears

int getYears()
Gets the duration of the mortgage term in years.

Returns:
years as int.

getInterval

Interval getInterval()
Gets the interval used to determine the payment. The interval can be weekly, biweekly, or monthly.

Returns:
Interval

setLoanAmt

PmtCalculator setLoanAmt(double loanAmt)
Sets the loan amount used to determine the payment. This method encourages implementations to be immutable by specifying that it returns an object that implements PmtCalculator.

Parameters:
loanAmt - the loan amount as double to be used to calculate the payment.
Returns:
PmtCalculator.

setInterestRate

PmtCalculator setInterestRate(double interestRate)
Sets the interest rate used to determine the payment. This method encourages implementations to be immutable by specifying that it returns an object that implements PmtCalculator.

Parameters:
interestRate - the interest rate as double to be used to calculate the payment.
Returns:
PmtCalculator.

setYears

PmtCalculator setYears(int years)
Sets the years used to determine the payment. This method encourages implementations to be immutable by specifying that it returns an object that implements PmtCalculator.

Parameters:
years - as int to be used to calculate the payment.
Returns:
PmtCalculator.

setInterval

PmtCalculator setInterval(Interval interval)
Sets the interval used to determine the payment. This method encourages implementations to be immutable by specifying that it returns an object that implements PmtCalculator.

Parameters:
interval - Interval object to be used to calculate the payment.
Returns:
PmtCalculator.

calcPmt

double calcPmt()
Calculates the payment. Implementations of this method should return the payment amount rounded.

Returns:
payment rounded as double.

calcPmtUnrounded

double calcPmtUnrounded()
Calculates the payment and returns it unrounded. This method is used by implementations of FixedAmortizationBuilder when building an amortization schedule.

Returns:
payment as double.
